title: Orora sells fibre business to Nippon Paper for $1.7b
text:
Packaging manufacturer Orora has sold its Australasian fibre business to Japanese firm Nippon Paper Industries for a sum that values the enterprise at $1.72 billion.

The company said it expects the deal to deliver net cash proceeds of $1.55 billion, of which around $1.2 billion will be returned to shareholders.

In response, Orora shares jumped 18 per cent to $3.19, which is the highest price since August.

Brian Lowe became Orora's CEO in September. Simon Schluter

Orora's board cited Nippon Paper's "strong track record of investment to support growth, including in people and technology" as part of its decision to accept the offer.

The ASX-listed company will retain its beverage and North American business.
description: The packaging manufacturer said it expects the deal to deliver net cash proceeds of $1.55 billion.
